boardgame.name: The Game of 49
boardgame.description: Starting with $49 apiece, players in The Game of 49 bid to buy spaces on the 49-square (7-by-7) game board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Randomly drawn number cards are auctioned one at a time, with the highest bidder placing a chip on the matching board space. Wild/Payoff cards give players a choice of where to place their chip and also award cash to all players for their chips on the board: $7 per chip, with a maximum payoff of $49._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The first player to claim four spaces in a row, in any direction, wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Opened, played once. Some of the cards stuck slightly when drying (manufacturing fault) causing some cards to be slightly _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;marked,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; but is not really a problem and is completely fixed w sleeves, which you would want if you play this game a lot anyway.
The contents in the box are like new (only played once). The box does have one corner that is dinged up (shipped this way to me), but the box is structurally in tact.
